sen.j: 石田 梅岩（いしだ ばいがん、貞享2年9月15日 (旧暦)（1685年10月12日） - 延享元年9月24日 (旧暦)（1744年10月29日））は江戸時代の思想家、倫理学。
sen.e: Baigan ISHIDA (October 12, 1685 - October 29, 1744) was a thinker and ethicist of the Edo period.
Baigan ISHIDA (October 12, 1685 - October 29, 1744) was a thinker and ethicist of the Edo period.
Baigan ISHIDA (October 12, 1685 - October 29, 1744) was a thinker and ethicist of the Edo period.

sen.j: 石門心学の開祖。
sen.e: He was the founder of Sekimon-shingaku.
He was the founder of Sekimon-shingaku.
He was the founder of Sekimon-shingaku.

sen.j: 名は興長。
sen.e: His name was Okinaga.
His name was Okinaga.
His name was Okinaga.

sen.j: 通称、勘平。
sen.e: His commo name was Kampei.
His common name was Kampei.
His common name was Kampei.

sen.j: 丹波国桑田郡東懸村（現：京都府亀岡市）に、百姓の次男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Kuwata County, the Province of Tanba as a peasant's second son.
He was born in Toge-mura, Kuwata County, the Province of Tanba (present Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture) as a peasant's second son.
sen.cmt: 「訳漏れ」東懸村（現：京都府亀岡市）
sen.e: He was born in Toge-mura, Kuwata County, the Province of Tanba (present Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture) as a peasant's second son.

sen.j: 1695年、11歳で呉服屋に丁稚奉公に出て、その後一旦故郷へ帰る。
sen.e: In 1695, he was apprenticed to a kimono shop at the age of 11, and then he once returned to his hometown.
In 1695, he was apprenticed to a kimono shop at the age of 11, and then he once returned to his hometown.
In 1695, he was apprenticed to a kimono shop at the age of 11, and then he once returned to his hometown.

sen.j: 1707年、23歳の時に再び奉公に出て働く。
sen.e: In 1707, he worked as an apprentice again at the age of 23.
In 1707, he worked as an apprentice again at the age of 23.
In 1707, he worked as an apprentice again at the age of 23.

sen.j: 1727年に出逢った在家の仏教者小栗了雲に師事して思想家への道を歩み始める。
sen.e: He started to follow the way to a thinker, studying under a lay Buddhist scholar Ryoun OGURI whom he met in 1727.
sen.cmt: 小栗了雲：読み不明一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He started to follow the way to a thinker, studying under a lay Buddhist scholar Ryoun OGURI whom he met in 1727.
He started to follow the way to a thinker, studying under a lay Buddhist scholar Ryoun OGURI whom he met in 1727.

sen.j: 45歳の時に借家の自宅で無料講座を開き、石門心学と呼ばれる思想を説いた。
sen.e: At the age of 45, he hosted a free lecture at his rented residence and taught the thought called Sekimon-shingaku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: At the age of 45, he hosted a free lecture at his rented residence and taught the thought called Sekimon-shingaku.
At the age of 45, he hosted a free lecture at his rented residence and taught the thought called Sekimon-shingaku.

sen.j: すなわち「学問とは心を尽くし性を知る」として心が自然と一体になり秩序をかたちづくる性理の学としている。
sen.e: Namely, it was "learning is to render mind and to know nature," learning of nature and the law wherein mind and nature are united to form the order.
Namely, it was "learning is to render mind and to know nature," learning of nature and the law wherein mind and nature are united to form the order.

This philosophy was based on the concept that 'learning is to do one's best and to understand nature'; in other words, this philosophy requires learning about nature and the law wherein mind and nature are united to form order.

sen.j: したがって梅岩自身は『性学』といっていた。
sen.e: Therefore, Baigan himself had called it "seigaku" (study of nature).
Therefore, Baigan himself had called it "seigaku" (study of nature).
Therefore, Baigan himself had called it "seigaku" (study of nature).

sen.j: しかし手島堵庵のなどの門弟たちによって『心学』の語が普及した。
sen.e: However, the term "shingaku" (study of nature) was spread by his pupils, such as Toan TEJIMA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, the term "shingaku" (study of nature) was spread by his pupils, such as Toan TEJIMA.
However, the term "shingaku" (study of nature) was spread by his pupils, such as Toan TEJIMA.

sen.j: 当初は男子のみを対象としていたが、聴講を望む婦女子多く、障子越しの別室にて拝聴を許された。
sen.e: Initially it was only for the men; then women were allowed to listen to the lecture in another room behind the shoji (partitions that can divide the interior of a building into separate rooms) since many women desired to attend.

Initially it was only for the men; then women were allowed to listen to the lecture in another room behind the shoji (partitions that can divide the interior of a building into separate rooms) since many women desired to attend.

Initially it was only for the men; then women were allowed to listen to the lecture in another room behind the shoji (partitions that can divide the interior of a building into separate rooms) since many women desired to attend.
He deceased at the age of 60 in 1744.
He deceased at the age of 60 in 1744.
He deceased at the age of 60 in 1744.

sen.j: その思想の根底にあったのは、宋学の流れを汲む天命論である。
sen.e: The thought was based on the providence theory, which followed Sogaku (Neo-Confucianism).
The thought was based on the providence theory, which followed Sogaku (Neo-Confucianism).
The thought was based on the providence theory, which followed Sogaku (Neo-Confucianism).

sen.j: 同様の思想で石田に先行する鈴木正三の職分説が士農工商のうち商人の職分を巧く説明出来なかった。
sen.e: Shosan SUZUKI's duty theory, which was similar thought and preceded with Ishida's, did not fully explain the duty of merchants among Shinokosho (hereditary four-status order consisting of warrior-rulers, peasants, artisans, and merchants).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Shosan SUZUKI's duty theory, which was a similar thought and preceded Ishida's, did not fully explain the duty of merchants among Shinokosho (hereditary four-status order consisting of warrior-rulers, peasants, artisans, and merchants).
sen.cmt: similar thought → a similar thought, preceded with → preceded
sen.e: Shosan SUZUKI's duty theory, which was a similar thought and preceded Ishida's, did not fully explain the duty of merchants among Shinokosho (hereditary four-status order consisting of warrior-rulers, peasants, artisans, and merchants).

sen.j: それに対し、石田は長年の商家勤めから商業の本質を熟知していた。
sen.e: On the other hand, Ishida had full knowledge of commercial essence from the years of work at mercantile house.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: On the other hand, Ishida had full knowledge of commercial essence from the years of work at mercantile house.
On the other hand, Ishida had full knowledge of commercial essence from the years of work at mercantile house.

sen.j: 「商業の本質は交換の仲介業であり、その重要性は他の職分に何ら劣るものではない」という立場を打ち立てて、商人の支持を集めた。
sen.e: He had established point of view, "commercial essence is the broking business of exchange, and the importance is not inferior to other duties in any way," and gained merchant's support.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He had established point of view, "commercial essence is the broking business of exchange, and the importance is not inferior to other duties in any way," and gained merchant's support.
He had established point of view, "commercial essence is the broking business of exchange, and the importance is not inferior to other duties in any way," and gained merchant's support.

sen.j: 最盛期には、門人400名にのぼった。
sen.e: There were 400 disciples at peak.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: There were 400 disciples at peak.
There were 400 disciples at peak.

sen.j: 京都呉服商人の手島堵庵(1718--86)、をはじめ「松翁道話」を著した布施松翁(1725--84)、心学道話の最高峰とされる「鳩翁道話」の柴田鳩翁(1783--1839)、このほかに・斎藤全門・大島有隣等優れた人材を輩出した。
sen.e: It turned out a great many talented persons, including Toan TEJIMA (1718-86), a kimono fabrics dealer of Kyoto, Shoo FUSE (1725-84), author of "Shoo Dowa," Kyuo SHIBATA (1783--1839), author of one of the best Shin school (Mind school) dowa (talks on the way) "Kyuo Dowa," Zenmon Saito and Urin Oshima.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。大島 有隣 http://fine-vn.com/cat_11/ent_84.html
sen.e: It produced many talented persons, including Toan TEJIMA (1718-86), a kimono fabrics dealer of Kyoto, Shoo FUSE (1725-84), author of "Shoo Dowa," Kyuo SHIBATA (1783--1839), author of one of the best Shin school (Mind school) dowa (talks on the way) "Kyuo Dowa," Zenmon Saito and Urin Oshima.
sen.cmt: Ｉt turned out a great many talented persons→It produced many talented persons
sen.e: It produced many talented persons, including Toan TEJIMA (1718-86), a kimono fabrics dealer of Kyoto, Shoo FUSE (1725-84), author of 'Shoo Dowa,' Kyuo SHIBATA (1783--1839), author of one of the best Shin school (Mind school) dowa (talks on the way) 'Kyuo Dowa,' Zenmon Saito and Urin Oshima.

sen.j: 倹約の奨励や富の蓄積を天命の実現と見る考え方はアメリカの社会学者ロバート・ニーリ・ベラーによってカルヴァン主義商業倫理の日本版とされた。
sen.e: Since he encouraged thrifty and regarded accumulation of wealth as achievement of God's will, American sociologist Robert Neelly Bellah saw his thought as Japanese version of Calvinism commercial ethics.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Since he encouraged thrifty and regarded accumulation of wealth as achievement of God's will, American sociologist Robert Neelly Bellah saw his thought as Japanese version of Calvinism commercial ethics.

Since he encouraged thrifty and regarded accumulation of wealth as achievement of God's will, American sociologist Robert Neelly Bellah saw his thought as Japanese version of Calvinism commercial ethics.

sen.j: 日本の産業革命成功の原動力ともされた。
sen.e: It was also considered as the motive power for the successful industrial revolution in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It was also considered as the motive power for the successful industrial revolution in Japan.
It was also considered as the motive power for the successful industrial revolution in Japan.

sen.j: 1970年代頃からの環境問題への意識の高まりや、企業の不祥事が続く中、CSR（Corporate Social Responsibility＝企業の社会的責任）ということが欧米を中心に盛んに言われるようになった。
sen.e: While the concerns to the environmental issue have been raised from the 1970s, and the scandals of the enterprise have happened one after another, CSR (corporate social responsibility) became a much-discussed subject especially in Europe and America.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: While the concerns to the environmental issue have been raised from the 1970s, and the scandals of enterprises have happened one after another, CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility) became a much-discussed subject especially in Europe and America.
sen.cmt: the scandals of the enterprise→the scandals of enterprises また、CSRの括弧内を、原文通り、最初の文字を大文字に訂正。
sen.e: While the concerns to the environmental issue have been raised from the 1970s, and the scandals of enterprises have happened one after another, CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility) became a much-discussed subject especially in Europe and America.

sen.j: そのような背景の中で「二重の利を取り、甘き毒を喰ひ、自死するやうなこと多かるべし」「実の商人は、先も立、我も立つことを思うなり」と、実にシンプルな言葉でCSRの本質的な精神を表現した石田梅岩の思想は、近江商人の「三方よし」の思想と並んで、「日本のCSRの原点」として脚光を浴びている。
sen.e: Within the context, Baigan ISHIDA's thought, which expressed the essential spirit of CSR with very simple words, such as "taking double profit and eating sweet poison often cause destruction" and "a true merchant thinks others as well as one self," is spotlighted as "the origin of Japanese CSR," along with "Sanpo-yoshi principle" of Omi shonin (Omi merchants).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Within the context, Baigan ISHIDA's thought, which expressed the essential spirit of CSR with very simple words, such as "taking double profit and eating sweet poison often cause destruction" and "a true merchant thinks others as well as one self," is spotlighted as "the origin of Japanese CSR," along with "Sanpo-yoshi principle" of Omi shonin (Omi merchants).

Within the context, Baigan ISHIDA's thought, which expressed the essential spirit of CSR with very simple words, such as 'taking double profit and eating sweet poison often cause destruction' and 'a true merchant thinks others as well as one self,' is spotlighted as 'the origin of Japanese CSR,' along with 'Sanpo-yoshi principle' of Omi shonin (Omi merchants).

sen.j: その思想もやはり営利活動を否定せず、倫理というよりむしろ「ビジネスの持続的発展」の観点から、本業の中で社会的責任を果たしていくことを説いている。
sen.e: The thought also does not deny a profit-making activity and teaches to achieve social responsibility in main business from a viewpoint of "sustainable development of business" rather than ethics.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The thought also does not deny a profit-making activity and teaches to achieve social responsibility in main business from a viewpoint of "sustainable development of business" rather than ethics.
The thought also does not deny a profit-making activity and teaches to achieve social responsibility in main business from a viewpoint of 'sustainable development of business' rather than ethics.

sen.j: 寄付や援助など本業以外での「社会貢献」を活動の中心とする欧米のCSRにはない特徴がある。
sen.e: Its feature differs from European and American CSR whose "philanthropy" is other than main business, such as contribution and support, as the core activity.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Its feature differs from European and American CSR whose "philanthropy" is other than main business, such as contribution and support, as the core activity.
Its feature differs from European and American CSR whose 'philanthropy' is other than main business, such as contribution and support, as the core activity.

sen.j: 主な著書に『都鄙問答』『倹約斉家論』がある。
sen.e: His main books are "Tohi Mondo" (City and Country Dialogues) and "Kenyakusaika Ron."
His main books are "Tohi Mondo" (City and Country Dialogues) and "Kenyakusaika Ron."
His main books are "Tohi Mondo" (City and Country Dialogues) and "Kenyakusaika Ron."

sen.j: 現在、京都府亀岡市の道の駅ガレリア亀岡内に石田梅巌記念施設「梅岩塾」が併設されている。
sen.e: At present, there is Baigan ISHIDA memorial facility "Baigan-juku" in Michi no Eki Galleria Kameoka, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.
At present, there is Baigan ISHIDA memorial facility "Baigan-juku" in Michi no Eki Galleria Kameoka, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.
At present, there is Baigan ISHIDA memorial facility 'Baigan-juku' in Michi no Eki Galleria Kameoka, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 大阪府堺市堺区の菅原神社 (堺市) に座像が安置されている。
sen.e: His seated figure is placed in Sugawara-jinja Shrine, Sakai Ward, Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture.
His seated figure is placed in Sugawara-jinja Shrine, Sakai Ward, Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture.
His seated figure is placed in Sugawara-jinja Shrine, Sakai Ward, Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: また、橋上駅に改築された出身地のJR亀岡駅の改札前に、新造の座像が置かれている。
sen.e: Moreover his new seated figure is located in front of a concourse in the reconstructed on bridge JR Kameoka Station in his hometown.
Moreover his new seated figure is located in the concourse of JR Kameoka Station which was reformed to an overhead station in his hometown.
sen.cmt: 「橋上駅」の訳に問題あり。また、「concourse」はそれ自体が広場を指すので、in front of → in に訂正。
sen.e: Moreover his new seated figure is located in the concourse of JR Kameoka Station which was reformed to an overhead station in his hometown.
